website_summaries.verdict: A very good beginner’s skate at a “try it out” price point, with sturdy ankle support, that will carry skaters through to a transition to more advanced skate skills.
pros: Very stiff ankle support and stable last that keeps feet centered over the blades
Fit most users comfortably, with little adjustment needed
cons: Skate uppers can break away from the sole after many uses or when doing more complex moves

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these on Feb. 20th. I am a recreational skater, skating 2x's per month. As of June 18th, which is almost 4 months since the date I ordered these skates, the boot has detached itself from the heel. I would not recommend these skates.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Sajkowski-Gulick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent skate for the beginner!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I was hesitant with these as I read some horror stories about huge sizes, receiving used skates, tongues tearing out. They seem perfect for the price for me.I wear a size 8 shoe and ordered size 8 skate. With some thick winter socks these fit perfect! Laces are a little long, but you can always wrap around if needed. I also purchased a better blade guard as the ones that come with the skates are very cheap protection. Can't wait to get out on the ice with them! I will update if they do not perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Subacz

customer_reviews.title: and really didn't look like they went with the skates
customer_reviews.text: Something just didn't look right with the skates, the blades looked a little different than the picture in the listing, and really didn't look like they went with the skates. They seemed too short, like they were for a smaller size skate. Also, one of the front blade plates did not fit flush against the boot at the front near the toe, and there was a gap. The blade plates were not positioned in the same spot on each sole either. They seemed to be put together in the factory in a sloppy, non-precise manner. I don't know if either of these issues could cause any performance problems but I just didn't feel secure and safe using them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wilsdorf

customer_reviews.title: Really great ice skates for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome ice skates for a beginner! They are very true to size. I wear size 7 boots - like UGGS - and these fit perfectly. I am still breaking them in and I believe I need to wear thick socks until they are wore in enough. I am also going to invest in a nice pair of blade covers so I can wear them around the house when I am not skating so they don't feel weird when I'm on the ice.
customer_reviews.author: F.R. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Decent beginner skates
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a pair of ice skates, but these seemed fine for a beginner, so I bought them on a hunch. I usually wear a 9-9.5 shoe size so I got the size 9 and they fit great. The blade guards are cheapo plastic; I pulled the skates out of the box and one guard was already cracked and chipped. Definitely recommend buying different guards. I don't know much about ice skates, but they seem comfy enough. I'll have to test them out on the ice for a true review.
customer_reviews.author: si1entshad0w

customer_reviews.title: The blades are dull and cause a lot of slippage
customer_reviews.text: For $30 they are alright. The boot itself has no structure so your ankles and feet end up destroyed after an hour or so. The blades are dull and cause a lot of slippage. I’m a fairly competant ice skater and couldn’t make these work for me. I tried them twice. I’ll keep looking. The upside is I’m not out any money as rentals would cost what I spent to use them twice. I’ll be donating and looking elsewhere. Are they skates? Yes. If you’re in a pinch, go ahead and get them. I would t recommend if you plan to skate more than a few times a year.
customer_reviews.author: sjbzher

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: I bought these skates for my daughter. I received them and barely looked at them before taking them to be sharpened as she needed them that week. When she went skating Friday night, she said they gapped funny at the ankle, causing discomfort while skating. Also, the stitching was off-center causing pressure on her feet in odd places. Like, to the point she could NOT skate. They were inexpensive skates, so I certainly didn't expect perfection but when she was literally unable to skate with them...I realized they were a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: After only 5 times skating in these skates, the leather heel area started to lift out of the black heel. No saving these skates. Returning for a refund. Ice skating rink who also purchased these same skates had the same issues and having to send them all back as well. I would spend more money and get a higher quality skate.
customer_reviews.author: KSchaezz

customer_reviews.title: Fits true to size
customer_reviews.text: These skates are pretty impressive especially for the price.. they do not come sharpened but it's only a few dollars to get them sharpened. I wear a size us 7 1/2 - 8 depending on shoe/sneaker I got a size 8 and they ft perfectly.. I do wear thick socks with them and can still wiggle my toes a bit which is what you want, you don't want your toes crammed in. These are extremely comfortable and have had no aching or pains as far as skates are concerned. I am very happy with these skates and definitely reccomend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie M

customer_reviews.title: Blades were not sharpened
customer_reviews.text: Skates are comfortable. Fit true to size. But these did NOT come sharpened like it says in description. Being a new skater, I did not know how to tell if the blade was sharp or not so I skated about 4 or 5 times before an instructor realized why I was struggling with a few techniques. Be sure to check your blade and get them sharpened before your first time on the ice with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Too tight at tough.
customer_reviews.text: While the size was correct, the fit was too tight at the toe mainly due to the tongue pushing down. We returned them and bought Riedell 119 Emerald  for our daughter and the fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Shows

customer_reviews.title: Great starter ice skating shoes
customer_reviews.text: Just beginning to learn to ice skate in my 20s and these are a great starter shoes. Literally anything is better than rental skates. I'm a size 6/6.5 in regular shoe size, got a size 5 for these and they fit fine. Be sure to get them sharpened before you use them. Will take a couple uses to soften up, afterwards it's smooth skating!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Yu

customer_reviews.title: Good Skates
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. My daughter asked for these for Christmas. I was leery of buying such inexpensive skates, but she has used them a few times and they've worked really well for her. She likes not having to rent skates. I was a little concerned as I bought these in her shoe size, but the fit has been great, not too tight. She even worse extra-thick socks with them once and they still fit. I don't know how long they will last, but she just skates for fun once or twice a week, and these seem perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: reesah mouse

customer_reviews.title: Get one size down
customer_reviews.text: The shoes came a little too big, I've got a lot of toe room, but they still work great. When I got them, I just started skating and it takes a few sessions to break them in properly (like any shoe), but after that, they were awesome. Very pleased with my skates.
customer_reviews.author: robin Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's a really great beginner shoe. I've only worn it once but I hope to go skating a lot this winter. I got them sharpened actually after my first skate but the first time I went I felt very stable in them and had no problem picking up speed or trying different tricks They were also fairly comfortable and tight around my foot
customer_reviews.author: Rivka

customer_reviews.title: For Wider Feet Only
customer_reviews.text: These are great for wide feet. If your foot width are average or narrow, these are not the shoes for you. If you’re attempting to learn anything more than skate forward, you will quickly feel wobbly on these, because your foot will scoot left and right inside of the shoe. It will never feel like a natural extension of your own foot because the blade will never be centered down the middle of your foot.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Normally I have a hard time finding things that fit, wearing a size 11. Items are usually too tight. These skates were PERFECT! They were actually a little big so i was able to wear double socks to keep my feet warm skating. I am very happy with these skates. They were inexpensive, fit perfect and are just what i wanted in a casual skate. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Blair1129

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these skates!!
customer_reviews.text: These skates are TERRIBLE for beginners they have no build and are made of flimsy material. If you are new to the figure skating world and you need some recreational or beginner skates I would suggest the jackson soft skates. For a better fit and feel on the ice. (there a great price too)
customer_reviews.author: BigRam190

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning skaters
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner skate. Make sure you get it sharpened before you use them for the first time. Also get yourself skate guards to protect them and they will last with proper care. Most skate parks want about $8-$10 skate rental so these skates pay for themselves after a couple skates
customer_reviews.author: Zephr

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Okay these are great quality skates at a low price. I ordered multiple pairs of these skates because daughter is at the awkward shoe stage where you can't figure out if she is still in youth sizes or ladies sizes. If I had to say I feel these ran a little large as one pair I ordered I could fit my feet into. So in my opinion they run a half a size big. I would buy again and probably will the way my daughters feet grow!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Runs Big!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on size before i purchased it but wasn't sure which size to order so ordered my regular shoe size. Bad idea, I want to exchange it for the smaller size but now the price is much more than what i paid for it. Also, i had to wait a while for this to ship. Not a happy customer at this moment, I will update my review if i am compensated for this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic skate for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, comfortable enough as far as skates go. They did not come sharpened at all- must have them sharpened before use. Definetly recomend these for those like me - occasional recreational skaters... i only really just do laps on the rink, fun and good exercise :)
customer_reviews.author: ErinE

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for casual fun
customer_reviews.text: My wife really liked the ice skates; my personal opinion is that this skates are just for casual use, if you consider that make this a great product. The reason I am giving only four starts because the blades did not came with sharp blade and that was not clear in the product description when I bought at least. Just a note the Blade Guards do not come included.
customer_reviews.author: Giorgio G.

customer_reviews.title: it is a very nice ice skate and very affordable (it paid for itself ...
customer_reviews.text: I realize now, that it doesn't fit quite right for me at the middle part/ankle- too much space and it kinda bends and digs in. But shoe shopping is generally a nightmare for me xD Other than the fit, it is a very nice ice skate and very affordable (it paid for itself after the first visit of the ice rink- and I had a lot of fun).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It has a flaw in it, but was so value priced it was still worth it.
customer_reviews.text: There is a bubble by the seam or gluing of the shoe to the skate. I don't know how long they might last. But the value was still worth it. My daughter has had a great time with these skates. That's all that counts.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: A good skate for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It is worth the money for a beginner skater. I read a lot of the feed back and ordered them anyway. I checked them over very closely when they arrived and it appears the company has addressed all the issues that were listed in previous customer feedbacks. So far they are great.
customer_reviews.author: waterbug74

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Skates for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: These skates are awesome for beginners. I work at an ice rink and was tired of using the rentals. They look clean and are comfortable and you can even do a few tricks with them. If you’re in between sizes I would size down but if you’re going to be wearing thick socks I would just stick to your true size. You want them to be secure around your ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Jennelle

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are cute! I think they're great for recreational use. You get what you pay for pretty much. Giving four stars cause I'm pretty sure they weren't sharpened but that's something I can easily get done at my local rink. I will say, order a size down. I wear a 7 in everything (women's) and reading the questions and reviews I got a size 6 and they fit perfectly. If you wanna get these to learn how to skate or for skating around the rink once and a while, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for kids who want to try out skating
customer_reviews.text: Best choice for kids who want to try out skating! Other skates are not worth the price when you don’t know if your kid will stay in the sport. My child loved not having to get the rental skates. They are great quality and a great option for growing feet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great skates for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a hit or miss for some but I took a chance a bought them for my 10 year old. The price is great and the skates were perfect. I didnt see any reason why not to but them my little still has growing feet. I recommend buying them.
customer_reviews.author: cmarcos84

customer_reviews.title: The material is really stiff at first but I managed to break them in fairly easily. I wear them at least twice a week ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for myself because I wanted to get into ice skating as a hobby and was tired of renting skates every time. I wear a size 6 shoe normally and the size 5 in these fits perfectly. They weren't sharp when I got them, so I had to take them to my local rink to get them sharpened before I could use them. The material is really stiff at first but I managed to break them in fairly easily. I wear them at least twice a week for about an hour and a half and I haven't had trouble with blisters or ankle support. They're not fantastic, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: My first ice skates. Wish I've gone for it earlier :) I wear shoe size 6.5/7 and this size 6 fits me. I did take it to sharpening (the rinks in my area are asking for ~$8). My first time on the ice with it, I feel like it's almost worse than wearing rental shoes. It didn't go forward as well, but did great with it "swaying" motion. I am assuming it is the "breaking in" period; I'm pretty sure it is. By the end of Hour 2, I feel good about them and glad I won't be paying rental fees. No more nasty feeling of wearing public pairs!
customer_reviews.author: jody

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent skate for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7-1/2 medium shoe and the size 7 skate fit fine even with a pair of heavy socks on. However, the skates ARE NOT pre-sharpened. I almost ended doing sideways splits when I stepped on the ice because my feet went out sideways because there was no edge to grip the ice. Had them sharpened immediately and they worked finde The skates are good for the part-time skater during the winter time (maybe once every two weeks). If you plan on skating a lot during the winter, buy a better pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Below

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These were very uncomfortable! They were also very stiff. It was so hard to skate in these. They did fit true to size. The customer service to return was very friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Needs sharpening :(
customer_reviews.text: I paid $26 for these. However, they need to be sharped. In NYC that costs another $20! Some people here say it is between $6-$10 to sharpen. I guess that is only if you are not in Queens, Manhattan, or Northern NJ.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Woman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for an introductory ice skating class and for such a cheap pair, the held up for the entire 4 months I used them! I ordered a size down from my normal shoe size and they fit perfectly. I did take off a star because they do not come presharpened which became a hassle to get done before the first classes begun.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita

customer_reviews.title: good quality and price here was best
customer_reviews.text: definately sharp blade, busted my a** first time out with these. real good quality and like i said before the best price i could find was here
customer_reviews.author: upinmaine

customer_reviews.title: Complements Each Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to learn how to skate. They rub on my ankles a bit, but they're great for me. I get complements each time I'm in the ice.
customer_reviews.author: TashaFay

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I just pulled this up to find that my return window closed 4 days ago. My daughter just came home from ice skating with a broken skate. These were delivered to us 1 month ago and have only been worn a few times and the boot came off of the heel. Very disappointing and I will be calling customer service tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: These are very basic, not thickly padded ice skates ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very basic, not thickly padded ice skates. I am "satisfied" but definitely not impressed. They are completely unsharpened when arriving, which is no problem. However they are not the most supportive shoe. They will be ok for occasional use. But if you want to go ice skating often, invest in a bit higher quality ice skates.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria S

customer_reviews.title: Reliable performance
customer_reviews.text: These skates were a gift. I bought 2 pair and both recipients said they felt comfortable and performed as expected for casual, recreational use all winter long.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A

customer_reviews.title: They fit good with thick socks
customer_reviews.text: Well, these skates reflect the price. I got blisters on my ankles after just one time of wearing them, despite wearing thick socks. The size seems true to normal shoe size. I wear size 7.5 and bought these skates size 8. They fit good with thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: Inna

customer_reviews.title: price is good, they arrived sharp (I asked at the pro ...
customer_reviews.text: price is good, they arrived sharp (I asked at the pro shop) and ... yeah. The price is good. But what is up with the tongue on these? It is like it is 30 percent too wide, it is all bunched around, and it seems to be sewn 1/4 inch lower than the laces. I don't know how to explain it, i've never seen a shoe fit like this before. These also run just crazy wide. I'm still glad I bought them because I can still manage to skate around with my kids using them, and it's a lot cheaper than renting skates every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: They are okay. Very stiff yet and hard to lace tight. I noticed the one skate the eyelets are level across. Overall they are okay. I swear a size 8.5. I have a bit of a wider foot. Size 8 fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: EMILY

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This deserves zero stars! Do not buy! You will break your ankles! They are wonky, and do not get tight enough around your ankles to skate well. The price tells you everything. They look like a cute pair of skates, but once you’re on the ice, there is zero support.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Skates With Just the Right Give
customer_reviews.text: Just all around comfortable and for a couple years I had so much fun with them. Then the heal came apart from the soul.
customer_reviews.author: Naturalwisdom

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe and not permitted.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter, who is a beginner taking lessons. She was so proud. The coach at SkateNation in Virginia made her take them off and refused to let her wear them. The reason is she said they are unsafe. I am returning. If the manufacturer wants to challenge this, I would encourage them to do so and update the result. Until then, do not buy. Very embarrassing and regretful.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice and shiny
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product. It appears tough and shiny. Unfortunately it comes a little tight and so useless for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: iSaM

customer_reviews.title: No blisters - the fit is perfect with some wool socks
customer_reviews.text: I wear a ladies size 7 street shoe, and I bought size 7 skates, the fit is perfect with some wool socks. I am a beginner, I skate occasionally (once a year-ish) for fun. I wore these the first time out for 3 hours, no blisters and they broke in great. I put them on laced tight, skated around the rink twice, then tightened them. I can't speak to their lasting over time, I've only worn them once. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Nice skate, packaged well, with reservations.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice ice skates that came in perfect condition with blade protectors and was packaged in a retail box. Lacing up the ice skates were easy but there seemed to be some bulk so that the ice skate tongue did not lay as flat as I hoped. I cannot truly assess if it is true to size because m feet are a little bigger (!) than the skate. If you wear 10.5 or 11 you may be OK, it your foot is typically bigger than 11 do not buy these.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. They definitely run big. My daughter wears a 9.5 or 10 in shoes, we got these in a 9 and they are big. Thick socks are a must!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing and true to size
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing and true to size. They come pre-sharpened and ready to go. My teenage daughter loves them- they were a perfect starter pair for the new or occasional skater.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Nice classic figure skate for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for Christmas and like them a lot! They feel like the skates I wore as a kid. They bit into my leg a bit where they hit at the top the first couple times I wore them but they seem to be breaking in now and are more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: rabbitrabbit

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Recreational Figure Skate
customer_reviews.text: This figure skate fit perfectly, and was much more comfortable that a skate rink rental. Highly recommend getting this skate for recreational use. It will save your feet and your money in rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: Ben & Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, picked a size down from my shoe size
customer_reviews.text: As someone who likes to casually ice skate these are perfect. Fit great, I normally wear a size 8 shoe so I bought a size 7 skate. I highly recond buying your own skates instead of paying rental fees, especially for this price! Paid off in two skate sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina Coronado

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're only skating once in a while or ...
customer_reviews.text: Great if you're only skating once in a while or you're a beginner. I usually skate every week maybe 1~2 times a week since the beginning of January and went through 2 pairs of these skates before getting better quality Jackson skates. The back of my skates started tearing apart from the sole after a few months and the boot starts to lose its stiffness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good skates, not pre-sharpened
customer_reviews.text: Good skates with very good quality for the price but they are not sharp and need to be sharpened before using.
customer_reviews.author: Ithacanfamily

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after some time
customer_reviews.text: They cracked near the heels , same as shown in reviews by others. Manufacturer is not approachable and non responsive. Avoid these at any cost
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these skates for my daughter for Christmas last year. The weather didn't cooperate so she used them twice last winter. The second time she used them this winter the heel completely detached from the skate. Very disappointing. I understand they are inexpensive but we expected to use them more than 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Order a size smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the skates were fine, but the sizing was way off. Even a thicker sock didn't fix the problem. Now my wife can't skate with me. Maybe next year.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Nice skates!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap deal, so happy! Great for skating, my daughter takes lessons and loves these skates. Happy customers!
customer_reviews.author: Always Forward

customer_reviews.title: Crap.
customer_reviews.text: Blade not centered on skate. It isn't aligned with the boot either. These skates are decorative not for skating.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine G.

customer_reviews.title: The Laces Made These Kind of a Pain
customer_reviews.text: Laces were a pain & they are not padded inside. I prefer the ones we rent! They have a sliding clasp over the foot and ankle & are fully padded.The laces made these harder to fit, as well as harder to put on & take off &they hurt. My daughter is a beginner at skating - maybe there is an advantage to laces for experienced skaters? Will be sending back.
customer_reviews.author: I Buy Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Buy one size smaller than your shoe size
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in the same size as what I wear in a regular shoe, and they were too big, so I had to send them back and exchange them for a size smaller. That size fits me really well. I used them for the first time tonight, and they fit very well and I was happy with their performance on the ice.
customer_reviews.author: FragmentedSandwiches

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We bought for 2 of our kids now and they live them. No complaints about discomfort. We sized up so they can wear thick socks.
customer_reviews.author: K Luff

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: It is rigid plastic which some skaters might not like. It runs big. In order to skate well, a skate should be snug. I always wear a size 8 shoe, but this skate was too roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie from Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The skates were fine for skating forwards and backwards, but fell apart once I started working on crossovers.
customer_reviews.author: Anna!

customer_reviews.title: Look very nice
customer_reviews.text: Won't be using these skates. They look very nice but I can't honestly review them as I bought them to use in a Christmas decoration.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on a better pair
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used these for all of 9 lessons, she started this past winter, but because of the pandemic, it was halted until July, they are already garbage. Should have listed to the bad reviews. Not happy, now I can get help since it’s been too long.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This was a good skate for beginners as I am. The only complaint I have is that the size runs big. I am a size 8 and this felt like a 9. I had to tighten the top threads so that I can keep balanced. So whatever size you are, get the size below.
customer_reviews.author: ny chik

customer_reviews.title: Nice Women’s Ice Skates
customer_reviews.text: These ice skates are comfortable, sturdy and easy to lace up
customer_reviews.author: R. N.

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are true to shoe size
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t got to try these yet but look like they will be a good value for the price. Waiting for our pond to freeze and do a true review.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Good start
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner and have only used them a handful of times. However they are soooooo much better then the rentals I've using. They're easier to lace, much more comfortable, better ankle support, and true to size. I just caution other noobs, watch out for the toe-pick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: They're awesome especially for beginners. Bought these for my 12yr old who has been in figure skating for close 2yrs now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible Skates
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these skates only twice the boot already started seperating from the heel. I skate only recreationally, so it's not like I was putting any sort of strain on the skate, they're just awful. On another note, they're just as uncomfortable as rental skates so you might as well stick with those.
customer_reviews.author: christina woodward

customer_reviews.title: Bonding over Ice Skates
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Took my daughter ice skating for the first time. She was thrill to have her own skates for future uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Udel

customer_reviews.title: Great value for recreational/starter skates!!!
customer_reviews.text: These skates are a great pair of starter skates! I live in Chicago, and my husband and I wanted to take advantage of the ice rinks this season. These skates have already paid for themselves in the rental fees we have avoided in just 3 visits! My only complaint is the time/difficulty it takes to get them laced up tightly enough to feel good on the ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Mandacake

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these and will be returning them as defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ice skates for my daughter to use during her ice skating lessons. One skate has 3 upper hooks ad the tongue is not long enough to cover the top grommet. The other skate has 4 upper hooks but the tongue does not mold around my daughter's foot and is a hard wrinkled mess. The metal from the blades is coming unrolled in little strips. I would not recommend these and will be returning them as defective.
customer_reviews.author: LVoskan

customer_reviews.title: Came without laces...
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner skater. I saw good reviews online for this brand of skate. I waited weeks for them to arrive. I was so excited to use them tonight for the first time but realized that one of the skates came without laces which is extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and used upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: If I could give 0 stars, I would. When these arrived, the minute I opened the box, I knew something was wrong. These we're obviously used skates to begin with. The box was ripped and the plastic bags containing the skates were also ripped. After closer inspection, the "leather" was strained and the heel had a chip in it. The metal hooks we're also bent in. These skates were used and then returned and then resold to me. What a rip-off. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 8/10, great for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm size 37.5 aprrox and took size 6, they were perfect for me. Blades got rusty after one time (dont use the black covers that the skates come with as blade guards!) but i managed to get it off. They are more comfy than i expected.
customer_reviews.author: kristina m.

customer_reviews.title: Excited about my new skates
customer_reviews.text: The skates fit great, and there will be room for socks. I haven't skated in them yet but they are nicer than I anticipated for the price. I am only a recreational skater but appreciate a fitted skate. So far I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap trash
customer_reviews.text: The boot separated from the heel causing a sprain. Absolutely garbage. Skates only used three times. Named "American" but are made in China. Deceptive Amazon. Shame on you.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Great ice skating boots for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery! Great quality product! Best value for the price! Highly recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great skates
customer_reviews.text: Great skates for the price - comfy ... you need to break in as they are stiff - once that is done - very flexible
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal! Just need sharpening
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with thick socks! Didn't give me blisters or ankle pain. My only issue is that the blades didn't come sharpened, and other reviews say they do so I went onto the ice assuming it'll be sharp enough. I'm going to need to get the sharpened asap before my next ice skating trip, but other than that, this is well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: mochaluca

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Get one size smaller I'm a size 8 and I choose a size 7 and it fit perfect. Worth the money if you dont like to rent out skates at the ice ring .
customer_reviews.author: Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Olympics!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a friend. Fit and work as they should. There ice skates, not an iPhone. Pretty self explanatory on what they are and how to use them. I would recommend them. Great support for your foot/ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Wicked_VFR

customer_reviews.title: after second use the skated broked
customer_reviews.text: after second use the skates broked, now my daughter has no skates for the course she was going to
customer_reviews.author: Alicja

customer_reviews.title: Awful skates. I wore them six times with about ...
customer_reviews.text: Awful skates. I wore them six times with about seven and a half to eight hours total on the ice before the leather cracked and the heel started detaching. If you're going to buy beginner skates with the intent to skate for a while, just spend the extra money for a quality pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has only skated three times this year, and these are falling apart with each time. Not sure they will last season.
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 10

customer_reviews.title: Decently comfortable skate for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used the a couple times so far and been very comfortable with my time on the ice. Support is typical of figure skates. Ankle area doesn't rub or cause any other discomfort so far. Looking forward to more time on them!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Nice skates!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice skates! So far, they are very comfortable and I am very happy with them. I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because they came un sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: Ira

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ice skate shoes~ I had a really good time of skating~
customer_reviews.author: Xi

customer_reviews.title: My own pair
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t worn them yet but will enjoy them when it’s time.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Good skates, good price
customer_reviews.text: I’m a size 9 normally and bought a size 9. They fit exactly as expected with thick socks. I skate maybe 1-2 times a month during the winter and haven’t had any issues with these. They are very comfortable and fit my needs as a beginner/casual skater.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So impressed
customer_reviews.text: These skates GLIDE over ice, I have never gotten that experience from rental skates. Your feet don’t turn in, there’s no pain on the sides of the ankles, so comfortable and easy to tie. You can’t beat that price for the quality of these. So impressed
customer_reviews.author: Casey Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great for Open Skate!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the beginner/intermediate lady who just wants them for the occasional Open Skate! If I were to take figure skating lessons, I'd purchase a higher quality pair of skates than these. But I only use them to attend Open Public Skate at our local rink about once a month or so. They feel very comfortable and work very well. I should also note that like all skates, I did have them sharpened. But I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: The brad fell off as soon as I laced it up. Rather large.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price, very comfortable (much better than any rental skate) and seem well made.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Fallon

product_meta.title: American Athletic Shoe Women's Tricot Lined Ice Skates
product_meta.description: Best selling entry level figure skate. The tricot lined figure skate is comfortable, fits well and has an easy care durable PVC boot. The skate features multi layered ankle support, hollow ground, nickel plated steel blade, full quarter padding for comfort and a form fitting padded tongue. A great entry level, pond or rink skate.
feature_bullets: Top selling figure skate fits great and looks great
Sizing is true to shoe size
The Package Weight Of The Product Is 6 Pounds
